definitions.definition: The act of assigning ; the allocation of a job or a set of tasks .
examples: This flow chart represents the assignment of tasks in our committee.

definitions.definition: The categorization of something as belonging to a specific category.
examples: We should not condone the assignment of asylum seekers to that of people smugglers.

subdefinitions.definition: ( LGBTQ ) The categorization of persons as belonging to the male or female sex .

examples: The assignment the department gave him proved to be quite challenging.

definitions.definition: A position to which someone is assigned.
examples: Unbeknownst to Mr Smith, his new assignment was in fact a demotion.

definitions.definition: ( education ) A task given to students, such as homework or coursework .
examples: Mrs Smith gave out our assignments , and said we had to finish them by Monday.

definitions.definition: ( law ) A transfer of a right or benefit from one person to another.
examples: The assignment of the lease has not been finalised yet.

definitions.definition: ( law ) A document that effects this transfer.
examples: Once you receive the assignment in the post, be sure to sign it and send it back as soon as possible.

definitions.definition: ( programming ) An operation that assigns a value to a variable .

main_definition: The act of assigning ; the allocation of a job or a set of tasks .
secondary_definitions: The categorization of something as belonging to a specific category.
A position to which someone is assigned.
( education ) A task given to students, such as homework or coursework .
( law ) A transfer of a right or benefit from one person to another.
( law ) A document that effects this transfer.
( programming ) An operation that assigns a value to a variable .
